name: Millwright
tagline: A simple ticket tracking system built to get things done.
body:
## Welcome to Millwright.
There are almost as many ticket tracking systems floating around the Internet as there are pictures of cats. I didn't find one that _really_ met the criteria that I was looking for, though. I wanted something that was simple and lightweight, but that didn't cost a million bucks or require tons of weird setup. Since the tracking systems I could find weren't meeting my criteria, I decided to make my own.

***

### Technology
Millwright is built using [node.js](http://nodejs.org/), [Express](http://expressjs.com/), [Mongoose](http://mongoosejs.com/) and [MongoDB](http://www.mongodb.org/), and the templating engine [Jade](http://jade-lang.com/).

### Screenshots
Millwright's main page is where the majority of work will be done.
![Main page as of 1/10/2014](http://i.imgur.com/DXy9A3c.png)

### Installation
To install the latest build of Millwright, ensure that you have git, node, and npm installed. You'll also need to have a mongodb instance running locally. Then just clone the repo and run app.js.

`git clone https://github.com/Linell/Millwright`

`cd Millwright && npm install`

`node app.js`
